questions.question_text: You need to implement a data migration strategy for moving from an on-premises SQL Server to Dataverse. Arrange the following steps in the correct order:

options.text: Analyze source data and identify data quality issues
Design the Dataverse data model and relationships
Create data maps between source and target
Perform test migration with sample data
Validate migrated data and reconcile discrepancies

explanation.correct: The correct order ensures data quality, proper mapping, testing before full migration, and validation. This minimizes risks and ensures data integrity throughout the migration process.
concepts: Always analyze data quality first to identify issues early
Design the target model before creating mappings
Test with sample data before full migration
Always validate and reconcile after migration

questions.question_text: Arrange the Power Platform ALM (Application Lifecycle Management) environments in the correct promotion order for a typical enterprise deployment:

explanation.correct: This is the standard ALM promotion path: Dev → SIT → UAT → Pre-Prod → Prod. Each environment serves a specific purpose in the deployment pipeline.
concepts: Development: Where developers build and unit test
SIT: Integration testing between components
UAT: Business users validate functionality
Pre-Prod: Final testing with production-like data
Production: Live environment for end users

questions.question_text: Click on the area in the Power Platform architecture diagram where you would implement Row Level Security (RLS):

explanation.correct: Row Level Security is implemented at the Dataverse level. This ensures consistent security across all Power Platform components that access the data.

incorrect.powerbi: While Power BI has its own RLS, in Power Platform solutions, the primary RLS is implemented in Dataverse
incorrect.powerapps: Power Apps respects Dataverse security but doesn't implement RLS directly
incorrect.powerautomate: Power Automate flows run in security context but don't implement RLS

questions.question_text:
CASE STUDY: Contoso Manufacturing

Contoso Manufacturing is implementing a Power Platform solution for their global operations. They have:
- 5,000 users across 10 manufacturing plants
- Integration with SAP ERP system
- Real-time production monitoring requirements
- Compliance with ISO 27001 and GDPR
- Budget of $500,000 for first year

Based on this scenario, answer the following:

sub_questions.question: What licensing model would you recommend?

options.text: Per app plan for all users
Per user plan for power users, per app for others
Per user plan for all users

sub_questions.question: Which integration pattern is most suitable for SAP integration?

options.text: Direct API calls from Power Automate
On-premises data gateway with scheduled refresh
Azure Service Bus with event-driven architecture

explanation.overall: This scenario requires a hybrid licensing approach to optimize costs, enterprise-grade integration for SAP, and careful consideration of compliance requirements.

details.licensing: Mixed licensing optimizes costs - power users who create content need per user licenses, while consumers can use per app licenses
details.integration: Service Bus provides reliable, scalable integration with proper error handling and retry logic for enterprise SAP integration

questions.question_text: True or False: You can use Power Automate desktop flows to automate legacy applications that don't have APIs.

explanation.correct: True. Power Automate desktop flows (RPA) can automate legacy applications through UI automation, even when APIs are not available.
explanation.additional: Desktop flows use UI automation to interact with applications just like a human would, making them perfect for legacy system integration.

questions.question_text: True or False: Dataverse for Teams has the same capabilities as the full Dataverse.

explanation.correct: False. Dataverse for Teams has limitations including 2GB storage per team, no custom plugins, limited API access, and simplified security model.
explanation.additional: Dataverse for Teams is designed for team-level apps with simpler requirements. For enterprise solutions, full Dataverse is required.

questions.question_text: Order the following Power BI deployment pipeline stages for a proper CI/CD implementation:

explanation.correct: Power BI deployment pipelines follow Dev → Test → Prod pattern. Each stage can have different data sources and configurations.
concepts: Development uses test/sample datasets
Test stage validates with UAT data
Production connects to live data sources

questions.question_text: Which of the following are valid triggers for Power Automate cloud flows? (Select all that apply)

options.text: When a Dataverse record is created, updated, or deleted
When a SharePoint item is modified
When an HTTP request is received

explanation.correct: Power Automate supports various triggers including Dataverse operations, schedules, SharePoint events, and HTTP requests.

incorrect.d: CPU usage monitoring is not a native Power Automate trigger. This would require external monitoring tools.

questions.question_text: Arrange the security layers in Power Platform from outermost to innermost:

explanation.correct: Security in Power Platform is layered: Azure AD controls access, then environment, then roles, and finally field-level security for granular control.
concepts: Azure AD: Authentication and conditional access
Environment: Who can access the environment
Security Roles: What entities/actions users can perform
Field Security: Specific field read/write permissions

questions.question_text: In the canvas app screen below, click where you would add a connection to Dataverse:

explanation.correct: Data connections in canvas apps are added through the Data panel on the left side of the screen. This is where you manage all data sources.

incorrect.screen-area: The screen area is for designing UI, not adding data connections
incorrect.properties: Properties panel configures selected controls, not data connections
incorrect.formula-bar: Formula bar is for writing expressions, not adding connections

questions.question_text: A client requires a solution that processes 1 million transactions daily with sub-second response time. Which architecture components should you include? (Select all that apply)

options.text: Azure Service Bus for message queuing
Redis Cache for frequently accessed data

explanation.correct: High-volume, low-latency solutions require Service Bus for async processing, Azure Functions for compute, and caching for performance.

incorrect.b: Standard Dataverse alone cannot handle this volume with sub-second response
incorrect.e: Synchronous plugins would create bottlenecks and timeout issues at this scale

questions.question_text: True or False: You can use the same solution package to deploy to both Dataverse for Teams and regular Dataverse environments.

explanation.correct: False. Solutions built for Dataverse for Teams cannot be directly imported to regular Dataverse due to different capabilities and schemas.
explanation.additional: You need to upgrade a Dataverse for Teams environment to full Dataverse before moving solutions to regular environments.

questions.question_text: Arrange the steps for implementing a Center of Excellence (CoE) for Power Platform:

options.text: Configure environment strategy and DLP policies

explanation.correct: CoE implementation starts with governance, then technical setup, policies, monitoring, training, and finally certification processes.
concepts: Governance team provides oversight and strategy
CoE Kit provides tools and templates
DLP policies enforce security
Monitoring ensures compliance
Training enables citizen developers
Certification ensures quality

questions.question_text:
CASE STUDY: Healthcare Provider Network

A healthcare network with 15 hospitals needs to implement a patient management system with:
- HIPAA compliance requirements
- Integration with multiple EMR systems
- Mobile access for 10,000 healthcare workers
- Real-time patient status tracking
- Automated appointment scheduling

Answer the following questions:

sub_questions.question: Which compliance features must be enabled?

options.text: Audit logging, encryption at rest and in transit, and customer-managed keys

sub_questions.question: What is the recommended mobile strategy?

options.text: Power Pages for all mobile access

explanation.overall: Healthcare requires comprehensive security, offline mobile capability, and careful integration with existing systems while maintaining HIPAA compliance.

details.compliance: HIPAA requires audit trails, encryption everywhere, and customer control of encryption keys
details.mobile: Canvas apps provide offline capability essential for healthcare workers who may lose connectivity in different hospital areas

questions.question_text: Which statements about Power Platform connectors are correct? (Select all that apply)

options.text: Custom connectors can be shared across environments
Standard connectors have no usage limits
On-premises data gateway enables hybrid connectivity

explanation.correct: Custom connectors can be packaged in solutions, premium connectors need licenses, and data gateway enables hybrid scenarios.

incorrect.c: Even standard connectors have throttling limits
incorrect.e: Not all connectors support triggers; some are action-only

questions.question_text: Order the layers of a typical Power Platform solution architecture from top to bottom:

explanation.correct: This layered architecture separates concerns: UI at top, then workflow, business logic, data storage, and integration at the foundation.
concepts: Presentation: User interfaces and experiences
Process: Workflow and automation
Business Logic: Complex calculations and rules
Data: Persistent storage
Integration: External system connectivity

questions.question_text: True or False: Power Virtual Agents can escalate conversations to human agents through Omnichannel for Customer Service.

explanation.correct: True. Power Virtual Agents integrates with Omnichannel for Customer Service to seamlessly escalate to human agents when needed.
explanation.additional: This escalation can be triggered by customer request, sentiment analysis, or when the bot cannot handle the query.

questions.question_text: Click on the component in the solution architecture where you would implement API throttling:

explanation.correct: Azure API Management is the correct place to implement API throttling, rate limiting, and quota management for external APIs.

incorrect.power-apps: Power Apps consume APIs but don't control throttling
incorrect.dataverse: Dataverse has built-in API limits but not configurable throttling
incorrect.power-automate: Power Automate respects throttling but doesn't implement it

questions.question_text: A financial services company needs to process loan applications with multiple approval stages. Which components would you recommend? (Select all that apply)

options.text: Business Process Flows for stage visualization
Canvas app for all user interfaces

explanation.correct: Complex approval processes benefit from BPF for visualization, Power Automate for workflow, model-driven apps for case management, and Power BI for analytics.

incorrect.c: Model-driven apps are better for complex business processes than canvas apps

questions.question_text: Arrange the steps for implementing disaster recovery for a Power Platform solution:

options.text: Create automated backup of solutions and data

explanation.correct: DR planning starts with requirements (RTO/RPO), then implementation of backups, redundancy, automation, testing, and documentation.
concepts: RTO: Recovery Time Objective - how quickly to restore
RPO: Recovery Point Objective - acceptable data loss
Geo-redundancy ensures data survives regional failures
Testing validates the DR plan actually works
Runbooks ensure anyone can execute recovery

questions.question_text: True or False: You can use Azure DevOps pipelines to deploy Power Platform solutions.

explanation.correct: True. Azure DevOps pipelines can be configured with Power Platform Build Tools to automate solution deployment across environments.
explanation.additional: This enables proper CI/CD practices including automated testing, approval gates, and version control integration.

questions.question_text: Which factors influence Power Platform capacity planning? (Select all that apply)

options.text: Number of API calls per day
Number of Power Automate flow runs

explanation.correct: Capacity planning must consider API limits, storage (database and file), flow runs, and environment needs to ensure adequate resources.

incorrect.d: UI design choices like color schemes don't affect capacity requirements

questions.question_text:
CASE STUDY: Global Retail Chain

A retail chain with 500 stores needs to modernize their inventory management:
- Real-time inventory tracking across all locations
- Integration with 3 different POS systems
- Mobile apps for store managers
- Predictive analytics for stock optimization
- Budget constraint of $300,000
- 6-month implementation timeline

Answer the following questions:

sub_questions.question: What is the most cost-effective integration approach for the POS systems?

options.text: Custom development for each POS system
Use existing connectors where available, custom connectors for others
Replace all POS systems with a single solution
Manual data entry from each system

sub_questions.question: Which analytics solution fits the budget and timeline?

options.text: Power BI with AI Insights and automated ML

explanation.overall: This scenario requires balancing cost, timeline, and functionality. Leveraging existing connectors and Power BI's built-in AI reduces development time and cost.

details.integration: Mixed approach using existing and custom connectors minimizes development while ensuring connectivity
details.analytics: Power BI with AI Insights provides predictive analytics without custom development, fitting budget and timeline

questions.question_text: Arrange the components of a data loss prevention (DLP) policy implementation:

options.text: Identify sensitive data types and classification
Define business and non-business data groups
Monitor and refine based on violations

explanation.correct: DLP implementation starts with data classification, grouping, policy creation, rules configuration, testing, and continuous monitoring.
concepts: Data classification identifies what needs protection
Grouping separates business from personal data
Policies enforce the rules at environment level
Connector rules prevent data leakage
Testing ensures policies don't break legitimate flows
Monitoring helps refine policies over time

questions.question_text: True or False: Power Apps portals and Power Pages are the same product with different names.

explanation.correct: False. While Power Pages evolved from Power Apps portals, Power Pages is a standalone product with enhanced features, separate licensing, and improved developer experience.
explanation.additional: Power Pages includes better design tools, more templates, and simplified pricing compared to the legacy Power Apps portals.

questions.question_text: Which techniques can optimize Dataverse performance? (Select all that apply)

options.text: Use filtered views instead of retrieving all records
Enable change tracking for incremental sync
Retrieve all columns for future use

explanation.correct: Performance optimization includes filtered data retrieval, change tracking, proper indexing, and server-side aggregation.

incorrect.c: Asynchronous plugins are preferred for non-critical operations to avoid blocking
incorrect.f: Only retrieve required columns to minimize data transfer and improve performance
